Articles.Content:
Here's a craft I made recently for a science trip to Eeloo. 

It has loads of dV to spare out and back, so making it a relatively easy mission even if you are not the greatest pilot. 

Craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/zfmtfvbt7dtrurn/Eloo%20lander%204.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/zfmtfvbt7dtrurn/Eloo%20lander%204.craft?dl=0)

![pjUXPJx.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/pjUXPJx.jpg)

![h869sll.png](http://i.imgur.com/h869sll.png)

![pjSF40S.png](http://i.imgur.com/pjSF40S.png)

![5FrsLcr.png](http://i.imgur.com/5FrsLcr.png)

![4Xgb9sz.png](http://i.imgur.com/4Xgb9sz.png)

![aOmnQLE.png](http://i.imgur.com/aOmnQLE.png)

![3VQxgBq.png](http://i.imgur.com/3VQxgBq.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-01T19:47:10Z" title="07/01/2015 07:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 1, 2015</time> by Foxster**
Using the ion engines on the last stage is a great idea!

> 
> Using the ion engines on the last stage is a great idea!

Thanks. Also handy to use a fuel cell when all the way out at Eeloo as solar cells aren't much good there. Makes for a lightweight but high dV stage.
On the transfer stage I like the removable fuel tanks!

> 
> On the transfer stage I like the removable fuel tanks!

Ta. Nothing like a little asparagus staging to tweeze out a bit more dV.

> 
> Ta. Nothing like a little asparagus staging to tweeze out a bit more dV.

 If you're gonna go to Eeloo without enough dV, you're gonna have a bad time.

> 
> If you're gonna go to Eeloo without enough dV, you're gonna have a bad time.

Wise words. Luckily this craft has dV to spare.

> 
> If you're gonna go to Eeloo without enough dV, you're gonna have a bad time.

Someones ready for some nar nar!

Great craft too! An Eeloo return is not to be sniffed at.
